intro: Synnema abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian starwort, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Synnema abyssinicum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
